thought: The Gmail send action currently uses static params which overrides dynamic params from input_data. To send personalized emails correctly, I should clear static params so the action uses input_data fields for sending.
plan: Set Gmail send action params to empty dict to use input_data for email parameters.
Keep input_data with dynamic email content as prepared in mainWorkflow.
Test sending of each email with correct subject and message.
Verify all emails are sent and received correctly.
criticism: Using static params in Gmail send action prevents dynamic email content per item. Clearing params will fix this issue.

tool_input.comments: Use dynamic parameters from input_data for sending emails via Gmail, no static params.
TODO: Test sending multiple emails with dynamic content
